citation.article-title: Heliorestis daurensis, gen. nov. sp. nov., An alkaliphilic rod-to-coiled-shaped phototrophic heliobacterium from a siberian soda lake

p.s: Description of Heliorestis daurensis sp. nov.
Heliorestis daurensis (dau.ren'sis, L.adj., the name of the geographic region Dauria (Daur Steppe, Russia); Heliorestis daurensis, the solar rope from Dauria.)
Cells 0.8–1.2 μm wide forming a coil or bent filament with a length of up to 20 μm.
Phototrophic; absorption maxima in intact cells at 788, 671, 576, 405, and 370 nm.
Grows phototrophically on pyruvate or acetate as carbon sources plus 0.5–2 mM sulfide in the presence of biotin; a small amount of yeast extract is highly stimulatory.
Alkaliphilic and mesophilic; optimal growth occurs at pH 9 (range, pH 7.5–10) and at 25–35 °C.
Phylogenetic position within the low-G+C, gram-positive bacteria.
Habitat: microbial mats of brackish soda lakes and alkaline shoreline soils.
Type strain: BT-H1T, isolated from Lake Barun Torey located on the Daur Steppe (South Chita region, Southeast Siberia).
Deposited in the American Type Culture Collection as ATCC 700798.
